com.complexible.common.io

Interface DataOutputFunnel<T,O extends DataOutput>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataOutputFunnels.Primitives

    public interface DataOutputFunnel<T,O extends DataOutput>

    Similar to the Guava Funnel, implementations of this class are expected to take the input provided to the funnel method and write it to the DataOutput object. To be used as an alternative to Serializable a way to generically encapsulate and algorithm for serializing an object in some form.

    There is no requirement, generally, that the serialization must be complete such that the object can be reconstructed later; however, concrete implementations can impose this as part of their design.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void funnel(T theObj, O theTo)
      Send a stream of data from the source object into the DataOutput sink.

    • Method Detail

      • funnel

        void funnel(T theObj,
            O theTo)
     throws IOException
        Send a stream of data from the source object into the DataOutput sink.
        Parameters:
        theObj - the object to read from
        theTo - the output to write to
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error writing
